meanings.definition: A device used to hold a tool in place.
meanings.sent1: The toolholders in the workshop keep the tools organized and easily accessible.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic reached for the toolholders on the wall to find the right wrench.
meanings.sent3: The toolholders on the workbench decided to go on strike until they were properly cleaned.
meanings.sent4: The toolholders in the shed stood like loyal soldiers, ready for any task.
meanings.sent5: The bright red toolholders gleamed in the sunlight, inviting anyone to come and use them.

meanings.definition: The person or thing that holds or supports a tool.
meanings.sent1: The toolholders in the garage always knew where to find the hammer.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the toolholders of the family, always fixing things around the house.
meanings.sent3: The toolholders at the construction site joked that they were the real brains behind the operation.
meanings.sent4: His strong arms acted as the toolholders for the heavy toolbox.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog became the toolholders for the young boy, carrying his tools wherever he went.
